intro: Premna dopii, commonly known as the Indian nettle or velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae, characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with blue or purple petals, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shady environments. Premna dopii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
